channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Spray tag not fixed, 24th October
item.description:
Oops spray tag on white painted pillar of Parish Mews. Reported recently and status was changed to 'fixed' but as seen in photo from today it is definitely not fixed. Can it be fully painted over or removed please?

Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Overgrown tree on 16 stapleton road, 24th October
item.description:
The tree is overgrown, gets caught in telephone lines and in windy conditions has branches falling off which could damage cars or injure people.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Stapleton Road, Upper Belvedere, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Builder illegally parked residence bay nosie mess nuisance, 24th October
item.description:
Builder working on 14-18 Chapter Chambers, SW1P 4NW parked illegally in residence bay across the road on Chapter St at corner of Esterbrooke St, Using van as workshop operating electric saw at back of van, making mess and noise+++. Traffic warden walked by an hour ago and ignored.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Chapter Street, Millbank, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Fallen tree / cones / barriers, 24th October
item.description:
Council came and fixed the paving and removed a huge concrete kerb. They left barriers and cones around it until it was collected. They came to collect the kerb but left all the other bits? Also as the branch fell in the storm and is now blocking the path.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Holmdene Avenue, Dulwich Village, London

item.title: Environmental Health Waste Fly Tipping, 24th October
item.description:
This area of unused parking spaces is continually being fly-tipped. Now the general household waste including rotting food and nappies is being dragged around as the foxes have ripped many of the dumped rubbish bags, making it an environmental health issue again.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Aberford Gardens, Charlton, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Mess outside 45 millfields, 24th October
item.description:
The bins are always put out totally full onto the pavement after collection day so they sit here for over a week, overflowing. But the main issue is the state of their front garden which has looked like this for YEARS. Please can someone help remove!!

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Millfields Road, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet
